question.text: Which one of the following statements is incorrect?

options.text: The medullary zone of kidney is divided into a few conical masses called medullary pyramids             projecting into the calyces.
Inside the kidney the cortical region extends in between the medullary pyramids as renal pelvis.
Glomerulus along with Bowman's capsule is called the renal corpuscle.
Renal corpuscle, proximal convoluted tubule (PCT) and distal convoluted tubule (DCT) of the             nephron are situated in the cortical region of kidney.

solution.text: Internal structure of Kidney shows the outer cortex and inner medulla. The medullary region shows minor calyces that join and form major calyces and that finally form renal pyramids. Nephron consists of a renal corpuscle that includes Bowman's capsule and Glomerulus. Renal corpuscle, PCT, DCT are situated in the cortex region while loop of henle lies at the junction of cortex and medulla in cortical nephrons and entirely in the medulla in Juxta medullary nephrons. Renal pyramids open into the region known as renal pelvis which continues as ureters outside the kidney. The cortical region extends in between the medulla and forms columns of Bertini.
